byline.original: By TAIMOOR SHAH and RAY RIVERA
byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah reported from Kandahar, and Ray Rivera from Kabul, Afghanistan.

abstract: Insurgents armed with guns and rocket-propelled grenades attack small NATO base in Kandahar, Afghanistan, killing an Afghan interpreter and wounding an American civilian contractor and two Afghan security guards.
snippet: One Afghan interpreter was killed, and an American civilian contractor and two Afghan security guards were wounded, in an attack at a small NATO base in Kandahar on Thursday.
lead_paragraph: One Afghan interpreter was killed, and an American civilian contractor and two Afghan security guards were wounded, in an attack at a small NATO base in Kandahar on Thursday.

headline.main: Insurgents Attack in Kandahar, Breaking Rare Respite
headline.print_headline: Insurgents Attack in Kandahar, Breaking Rare Respite
headline.seo: Kandahar NATO Base Attacked by Insurgents
